definition: to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: Traditional Beijing roast duck is famous all over the world with a hundred years of history.
sentences.chinese: 老北京前门烤鸭名扬四海，至今已有百余年的历史。

sentences.english: Her worldwide fame is his support.
sentences.chinese: 她名扬四海应归功于他的支持。

sentences.english: Then their love story is world-famous.
sentences.chinese: 于是那爱情故事名扬四海。

sentences.english: Her worldwide fame is due to his support.
sentences.chinese: 她名扬四海应归功于他的支持。

sentences.english: This young man should do well, and may even rise to great fame .
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻人一定会做得很出色，甚至还可能名扬四海。

sentences.english: I'm gonna make it to heaven, Light up the sky like a flame fame.
sentences.chinese: 我要在天堂舞蹈，火光照亮天际名扬四海。
我们的交战将会名扬四海。

sentences.english: is best known for his book A Brief History of Time.
sentences.chinese: 霍金教授因其《时间简史》一书而名扬四海。
记住我的名字名扬四海。

sentences.english: "Shuan Yangrou" of Dong-Lai-Shun is world renowned I know.
sentences.chinese: 我知道东来顺的涮羊肉名扬四海。

definition: to make a name/to become famous
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
seasoned/honed to perfection over centuries/special reserve
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
